subtitle: These herby batter puddings filled with parsnip and onion are great served with horseradish sauce.

method.text: Steam or boil the parsnip until just tender. Drain well.
Using a paper towel dipped in oil, grease each compartment of a Yorkshire pudding tin. Place in the oven for 5 min to heat the oil. Add the onion wedges. Return to the oven for 3-5 min.
Meanwhile, sift the flour, mustard powder and salt into a bowl. Make a well in the centre. Break the egg into the well. Add half the milk and water.
Gradually mix the flour into the liquid to make a smooth paste. Whisk in the remaining milk and water to form a lump free butter. Stir in the parsley.
Divide the parsnips between the pudding tins. Pour over the batter. Return to the top shelf of the oven and bake for 30-35 min or until risen and golden. Serve immediately.

title: Parsnip batter puddings
